column1: 76 year old male. It occurs in pulmonary stenosis for acute abdomen, so abdominal computed/computerized tomography is required.
The patient has not traveled, but possible contact with people from areas at risk is suspected.
Intestinal perforation is needed that requires surgical treatment and a suspicious lung picture, so FOV is enlarged in the chest and nCOV-19 swab is required.
There is an exitus of the patient immediately after the emergency surgery and a positive result of the swab, post-mortem joint.
Multiples Lung thickenings, mainly of the frosted glass type with ubiquitous distribution bilaterally.
Air flap in peritoneal cavity compatible with intestinal perforation and free intra-abdominal effusion.
